response:
Imaging and CSF studies are required to confirm central demyelination and demonstrate dissemination in space and time, while excluding alternative inflammatory, infectious or structural causes. Electrophysiology and targeted blood tests help characterise the peripheral neuropathy and radiculopathy and identify reversible metabolic or autoimmune contributors before initiating disease-modifying therapy.
